reliabilityIssues: maqtu' - stops at tabi'i, does not reach Prophet

chainIssues: Chain is maqtu' (cut off at Mujahid, a Tabi'i)
Multiple weak narrators: Warqa ibn Abi Najjah and Ibn Abi Najjah are both da'if
Transmission terms shift from direct (ثنا/نا) to indirect (عن) in later part of chain
First narrators (Muhammad and Ibrahim) have uncertain reliability status
This is a ta'wil (interpretation) of Mujahid about the meaning of al-Sur, not a hadith from the Prophet

potential_issues.issue: Weak narrators in chain: Warqa ibn Abi Najjah and Ibn Abi Najjah are both graded as da'if
potential_issues.impact: Significantly weakens the chain as both da'if narrators appear consecutively

potential_issues.issue: Maqtu' chain - stops at Mujahid (Tabi'i), not reaching the Prophet ﷺ
potential_issues.impact: This is a statement of interpretation (ta'wil) by Mujahid, not an actual hadith from the Prophet ﷺ

potential_issues.issue: First transmitter (Muhammad ibn al-Husayn) is majhul (unknown)
potential_issues.impact: Beginning of chain has unreliable narrator with insufficient biographical data

potential_issues.issue: Transmission term shift: Direct terms (ثنا/نا) followed by indirect terms (عن)
potential_issues.impact: Ambiguity in the final connections of the chain

Topics: Description of the Trumpet (al-Sur) in the Qur'an

chainIssues: This entry is not a hadith but a chapter/surah heading or title

potential_issues.impact: This entry is purely a section marker or title, containing no actual hadith content or chain of transmission

english_translation: Narrated by al-Hasan: It reached Umar ibn al-Khattab about a man that he disliked something about. He said: So he wrote to him from Abdullah Umar, Commander of the Believers, to so-and-so: 'As for what follows, Ha-Mim. The revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Mighty and Knowing (40:1-2) - meaning the Knowing of what I do; Forgiver of sins (40:3) - meaning if I seek forgiveness, I will be forgiven; Acceptor of repentance (40:3) - meaning if I repent, He will accept my repentance and forgive me; Severe in punishment (40:3) - meaning if I do not act, He will punish me; Possessor of bounty (40:3) - meaning possessor of favors and blessings upon me; There is no deity except Him, to Him is the return (40:3) - meaning to Him is my return, there is no escaping return to Him. He said: So his repentance became good, and he said: Allah has spoken the truth and Umar has given sincere counsel'
